intro: Micromeria gracilis, commonly known as the slender micromeria, is a small shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Micromeria gracilis is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
